titleStmt.title: From Scotland. Tvvo coppies of letters, the one sent from His Maiestie Aug. 31. to the Lord Keeper, and by him read uuto [sic] the Lords in Parliament. Wherein is contained foure reasons why he subscribed not unto the commission sent to him. The other Sept. 1. from a gentleman to his friend, concerning the proceedings of the Parliament in Scotland.
titleStmt.author: R. C., Gentleman.

titleStmt.title: From Scotland. Tvvo coppies of letters, the one sent from His Maiestie Aug. 31. to the Lord Keeper, and by him read uuto [sic] the Lords in Parliament. Wherein is contained foure reasons why he subscribed not unto the commission sent to him. The other Sept. 1. from a gentleman to his friend, concerning the proceedings of the Parliament in Scotland.
titleStmt.author: R. C., Gentleman.
Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.

notesStmt.note: The King's letter is represented only by a brief summary; the other letter, composed of miscellaneous news items, is signed (p. 5): R. C.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
